# Badges para adicionar ao README.md

Copie e cole estas badges no topo do seu README.md:

```markdown
![Build Status](https://github.com/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes/workflows/Build%20and%20Release%20Windows/badge.svg)
![Latest Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes)
![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes/total)
![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes)
```

**Substitua `SEU_USUARIO` pelo seu username do GitHub!**

Exemplo completo para o início do README:

```markdown
# MikroTik Link Dashboard

![Build Status](https://github.com/victorhfsilva/mikrotik-routes/workflows/Build%20and%20Release%20Windows/badge.svg)
![Latest Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/victorhfsilva/mikrotik-routes)
![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/github/downloads/victorhfsilva/mikrotik-routes/total)

App pra chavear link no MikroTik sem precisar abrir Winbox ou acessar via web...
```

## Outras badges úteis:

```markdown
![Platform](https://img.shields.io/badge/platform-Windows-blue)
![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.11-blue)
![Last Commit](https://img.shields.io/github/last-commit/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes)
![Repo Size](https://img.shields.io/github/repo-size/SEU_USUARIO/mikrotik-routes)
```
